name: Chris Tucker
politicalViews: Tucker is a Democrat, though his political energies mostly go toward humanitarian efforts in Africa.
author: Tom Kershaw

content.text: Chris Tucker was born in Atlanta, Georgia and grew up in Decatur, Georgia.

There's very little specific information on Tucker's religious views, either now or during his childhood. He once said, in reference to drug use, that his mother raised him to not allow anything to control him,
content.sourceTitle: Chris Tucker's Journey from Tax Problems to 'Silver Linings Playbook.'

content.text: indicating some sort of moral upbringing.
We do know that in 1997, after the filming of
Money Talks
, Tucker became a devout born-again Christian.
However, the circumstances or details of his conversion (or what he converted from) remain a mystery.
In 2005, Tucker was pulled over for going 109 mph and attempting to allude law enforcement in Georgia. His excuse? He was late for church.
content.sourceTitle: 10 Hollywood Performers Who You May Not Have Known Are Christians

content.text: If that's true, it means that Tucker certainly takes church very seriously.
His religious views have interfered with his career to some degree. His co-star and creator of the
Friday
film series, Ice Cube, expressed concern that Tucker's religion may prevent him from making a returning appearance in the 2nd and 3rd installments of the series.
content.sourceTitle: Ice Cube Discusses Chris Tucker Reprising 'Smokey' Role In New 'Friday' Movie

content.text: Ultimately, Tucker did not return to the series, though it's uncertain if the reasons were religious in nature.
A fan of diversity
Tucker isn't all that political in the traditional sense. We know that he did vote for Obama in 2008, despite being a personal friend of the Clintons.
content.sourceTitle: Chris Tucker Talks Pres. Bill Clinton, Africa & His Charitable Efforts

content.text: (You know, because Hillary ran against Obama in the 2008 primaries.) When asked about his reasons, he said:

Obama was going to another charity event in L.A. and me and him shared a car together. I didn't know he was going to be president! He signed a book for me, and we talked about basketball … and chicken. No, I'm kidding about the chicken. But that's why I ended up voting for him cause I knew he was a good guy.
content.sourceTitle: Chris Tucker's Journey from Tax Problems to 'Silver Linings Playbook.'

content.text: However, Tucker is a humanitarian and avid traveler to Africa. He's made numerous charitable trips to poor African communities.
content.sourceTitle: Chris Tucker Talks Pres. Bill Clinton, Africa & His Charitable Efforts

content.text: He said:
You know, we're missing so much as African-Americans and we should be concerned about what's going on in Africa.
That doesn't mean Tucker isn't excited about a black man in office, or any minority for that matter:
This country is just that great that the opportunities are there for a Hispanic president, a black president or any other race for a president, yes.

ImageDescription.value:
Chris Tucker.

In celebration of Black History Month, CFC (Canadian Film Centre), Clement Virgo Productions and TD are pleased to present a special evening honouring acclaimed actor/comedian Chris Tucker (Silver Linings Playbook, Rush Hour 1, 2 & 3, Jackie Brown, Fifth Element.)

Hosted by CBC's Garvia Bailey, An Evening Honouring Chris Tucker celebrated Tucker's distinct and hugely popular body of work through conversation and clips, and allowed Toronto audiences to participate in a Q&A about his inspirations, entering the film business, the choices of roles, and the challenges he has faced along the way.
